titles.title: Child Hostage Act of 1996
To amend title 18, United States Code, to penalize those who endanger children in hostage situations.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime.

bill.summary: 9/19/1996--Introduced. Child Hostage Act of 1996 - Amends the Federal criminal code to impose penalties upon any person who, having custody or control over a child (under age 18), knowingly, and with reckless disregard for the child's safety, keeps that child in a situation in which such child could be endangered during a Federal law enforcement action.
